text: [Applause]
why are all of these people protesting
well they're part of a growing movement
to abolish ice
that's the US Immigration and Customs
Enforcement branch of the Department of
Homeland Security it started as a
protest slogan against immigration
enforcement by many who were protesting
the actions of the agency with regard to
how they were enforcing immigration laws
protesters are especially condemning the
agency for enforcing the separation of
migrant families under president Trump's
zero-tolerance policy this president has
advocated much stronger much stricter
much harsher enforcement policies and
that's being carried out by this
organization but what started out only
as a hashtag and a slogan is also
stirring up politicians some progressive
candidates have even used the movement
in their campaigning in order for us to
feel safer in our streets our churches
our schools and our homes we must
abolish ice in Congress I'll work to
close ice down and a group of Democratic
lawmakers on the left are promising to
turn the rallying cry into policy
they've received backlash from the
president and his administration these
spurious attacks on ice by our political
leaders must stop but now our Democrats
are thrilled with the idea should ice
exist it will certainly ice has a
purpose ice has a role so why is the
agency so important it was created as
part of an administrative organizational
plan from the George W Bush
administration following the enactment
of the Homeland Security Act of 2002
which created the Department of Homeland
Security in addition to the immigration
enforcement functions of ice ice
conducts a lot of multinational
investigations of transnational criminal
organizations it investigates child
pornography counter-proliferation a host
of other laws so what could replace ice
the group of lawmakers has yet to
provide any ideas on what could replace
the agency if they were abolished if you
were to get rid of the agency the
question becomes what do you do with
this function that's the million-dollar
question
the only concrete suggestion has come
from ice itself 19 ice investigators
signed a letter to the Department of
Homeland Security proposing to
restructure the agency into two separate
entities one would focus on immigration
enforcement and the other on homeland
security investigations most protest
movements do start with extreme
positions that can turn into policies
maybe at some point we'll meet in the
middle and figure out what we want to do
for real
[Music]
